str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: From epi and choregeo; to furnish besides, i.e. Fully supply, aid or contribute.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: From sun and bibazo (by reduplication) of the base of basis); to drive together, i.e. Unite, to infer, show, teach.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A band, fastening (hence, possibly: a ligament), joint. From haptomai; probably a ligament.
And, even, also, namely.
That which binds together; a band, bond. From sun and desmon; a joint tie, i.e. Ligament, uniting principle, control.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Increasing, increase, growth. From auzano; growth.
